intro: Strobilanthes psilostachys, commonly known as the narrow-leaved makepeace, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and striking spikes of tubular flowers. The plant typically blooms in the summer months, producing vividly colored flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
